Job Description:
Assistant Cook Job Description:
An Assistant Cook, or Assistant Chef ensures the kitchen is orderly and assists Cooks to prepare and arrange food. Their duties include cleaning the kitchen area, washing dishes and utensils and ensuring that the Cook has everything required to run the kitchen efficiently.
Assistant Cook duties and responsibilities:
 Assisting the Cook in food preparation activities, such as cleaning, cutting, chopping and peeling food ingredients
 Cleaning and sanitising the food preparation areas based on company and industry hygiene codes and health and safety standards
 Washing, disinfecting and properly storing cooking and kitchen utensils and equipment
 Buying, weighing and storing ingredients and food supplies
 Operating a variety of kitchen appliances and instruments including cutters, knives, mixers and ovens
 Managing inventory, unloading supplies and organising the storeroom
 Participates in and/or contributes to programs, committees, or projects designed to improve quality of service and employee productivity.
 Maintains clean work areas, utensils, and equipment.
 Develop new menu items while improvising the existing ones.
 Maintain and manage kitchen expenses,food costs, inventory, and staffing with in budgetary limits.
 Able to cook north Indian food.
 Able to do shift work.

In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing required materials, services and suppliers in both domestic and international markets. You will play a critical role in managing procurement activities, ensuring cost efficiency, and maintaining compliance with procurement policies and procedures.

Source for required materials, services, and suppliers in the domestic and international market.
Understand purchase requirements and source accurately and efficiently.
Identify and engage with global prospective suppliers to foster beneficial relationships.
Understand market trends and seek to improve cost efficiency.

Coordinate procurement related matters with requestors and vendors.
Prepare and conduct tender process.
Propose new vendors and evaluate existing vendors.
Contracts management.
Working with legal counsel to review and prepare contractual documents.
Address procurement related queries from internal management and stakeholders.

Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
A proactive team player who can work collaboratively to achieve organizational goals.
Capable of working independently with strong negotiation skills.
Detail-oriented, analytical, and possesses excellent problem-solving abilities. Excellent team member, proactive in managing issues and possess sense of responsibility and ownership in his/her work and results.

Job Description:
What you'll do:
As a Client Operations Executive, your role will be pivotal in ensuring smooth operations within the organisation. You will act as the first point of contact for clients, handling their account or trade-related queries. Your excellent problem-solving skills will be put to use as you monitor platform processes, ensuring successful execution of system batch runs for hourly settlements. In case of any system or data feed outage, you will activate contingency procedures to mitigate impact. You will also monitor members' margin balance positions and manage margin calls proactively. Your keen eye for detail will be crucial in monitoring members' credit or concentration limits and managing risk limit exposure. Any major operational process, system run or data feed failures will be escalated by you to Ops management for prompt resolution. Additionally, you will perform level 1 analysis and review of market surveillance alerts.
Act as the first line of client support on Members account or trade related queries.
Monitor platform processes and ensure successful execution of system batch run for hourly settlement.
Activate contingent procedure to mitigate any system or data feed outage affecting system batch run and hourly margin computation.
Monitor members margin balance position and manage margin calls proactively.
Monitor members credit or concentration limit and manage risk limit exposure.
Escalate major operation process, system run or data feed failures to Ops management for prompt resolution.
Perform level 1 analysis and review of market surveillance alerts.
What you bring:

Job Description:
Position Overview:The Head Bartender is responsible for managing all bar operations, ensuring high-quality service, creating signature cocktails, and training bar staff. This role requires a deep knowledge of mixology, customer service, and leadership. The Head Bartender will work closely with the management team to develop menus, maintain inventory, and uphold the establishment's standards.
Key Responsibilities:
Bar Operations Management:Oversee daily bar operations, including opening and closing procedures.
Ensure all beverages are served according to standard recipes and presentation guidelines.
Maintain cleanliness and organization of the bar area, adhering to health and safety regulations.
Coordinate with suppliers for stock and inventory management.
Customer Service:Provide exceptional service to guests, ensuring a welcoming and memorable experience.
Handle guest complaints and inquiries professionally.
Interact with customers to gather feedback and ensure satisfaction.
Cocktail & Menu Creation:Develop and craft signature cocktails that align with the establishments theme and standards.
Stay updated with current trends in mixology and incorporate them into the menu.
Collaborate with the culinary team to create food and beverage pairings.
Staff Management & Training:Train, mentor, and supervise bartenders and bar backs.
Set performance standards and provide regular feedback to the team.
Schedule shifts and manage staff rotas to ensure adequate coverage during peak hours.
Inventory & Cost Control:Manage inventory levels and conduct regular stock checks.
Track and minimize wastage and loss.
Assist in setting beverage prices and monitor cost controls.
Compliance & Safety:Ensure compliance with all local regulations, including alcohol service laws.
Enforce responsible alcohol service and manage intoxicated customers.
Promotion & Event Management:Assist in promoting special events, happy hours, and promotions.
Collaborate with marketing teams for social media content and promotional materials.

Job Description:
At EY, youll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And were counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

People Consulting shapes and delivers the part of business strategy that depends on people. As a professional under this contract, you will have the opportunity to work with one of our largest clients to understand and address their challenges amidst an organization-wide learning transformation.

We believe that you should own and shape your career. But well provide the support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Your Key Responsibilities
Youll work with one of our largest clients to help them get the most out of their people. Youll use your knowledge and experience to help the client transforming its learning practices. With access to talented leaders, formal learning and a wide variety of practical experience, youll receive all the support you need to succeed.

Skills and attributes for success
Supporting client in their transformation journey with learning transformation efforts
Perform analyses of learning needs and redesign learning processes to ensure alignment with learning objectives and improve efficiency of resources used towards learning efforts
Improve the effectiveness of learning programs to more effectively achieve desired business outcomes.
To qualify for the role you must have
Bachelors in business, Commerce, Human Resources Management and/or other relevant disciplines
Certificates in ACTA/ACLP 1.0 or 2.0 is preferred
Prior experience in areas such as Learning business process redesign, learning science, curriculum design and learning analytics outcome would be an advantage.
At least 7 years of working experiences including 5 years in management consulting role
Proven ability to build valued relationships with stakeholders
Passion to create a positive learning culture, to coach and develop team members and clients
Good communications skills, especially fluent in written and spoken English.
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, youll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where youll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

About Us:
MindFlex Education Pte Ltd is Singapore's #1 and largest Education Agency. Our team is highly focused on bringing the best value to our clients, whilst building an enjoyable and vibrant office culture. Cultivating and caring about our personnel remains at the heart of our company. We promote a fun-filled family-like environment with no overtime culture.
We are currently expanding and looking for fresh & enthusiastic talent to join our team. If you are a great team player with a good sense of responsibility and work ethic, do apply to for this role and we would love to get in touch with you!

Job Scope:
- Handle Day-To-Day Business Operations of Singapore's #1 Education Agency
- Attend to interested clients via various forms of warm leads (form orders, calls, WhatsApp, etc)
(no cold-calling at all!)
- Assist clients in shortlisting and recommending suitable tutor profiles based on their criteria
- Coordinate and arrange 1st tuition lesson for both clients and tutors
- Follow-up with any necessary administrative support and after-sales service
- Familiarize with and utilize custom-made company software which is focused on automation

Job Requirements:
- Friendly, Passionate and Energetic Team Player
- Organized and Good Administrative Skills
- Responsible and Strong Work Ethic
- Decent Typing Speed and Computer Skills
- Polite, Patient and Good Customer Services Skills
- Able to Commit for Minimum of 1 Year
- Poly & University Fresh Graduates are welcome, no experience required

Salary:
- Competitive salary structured towards helping employees grow with the company
- $2,700-$4,300/Month + CPF (inclusive of team incentives)
- Base starts from $2,500-$3,500/Month
- Attractive monthly team incentives from $200-$800/Month
- Clear Salary Progression, Annual Salary Review (Minimum 5-10% Increase)
- Management positions available (for candidates identified with leadership potential)

Working Hours:
- 4 Weekdays, 1 Weekend OR 3 Weekdays 2 Weekends
- 9.00am - 6.30pm
- Strictly No Overtime and No Bring-Work-Home Culture

Why Choose Us:
- Fun Working Environment with a Warm Company Culture
- Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
- Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games, Massage Chair, Fully-stocked Pantry, etc.)
- Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
- Full Leave Benefits: PH, Annual Leave, Sick Leave
- Career Progression and Low Staff Turnover Rate
- Bright Hill MRT (Thomson-East Coast Line) at Doorstep of Office

Others:
- Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
- Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful employment

The Senior cook will prepare meals and follow establishment recipes. Duties include preparing ingredients, adhering to the restaurant menu, and following food health and safety procedures.  Setting up, cleaning, and organizing work stations

 Able to work early mornings, nights, and weekends
 Must pass a background check
 Able to read and write

Job Description:
The Domain Coach is pivotal in embedding agile principles and ways of working within the Domain, guiding the leadership team, and ensuring that the delivery of value is customer-centric and aligned with Rio Tinto's strategic objectives. This role is responsible for facilitating the adoption and maturity of agile ways of working, advocating continuous improvement, and enhancing team collaboration and decision-making.
By driving the adoption of lean-agile metrics and practices, the Domain Coach plays a crucial role in optimising processes, resolving conflicts, and acting as a liaison with governance bodies to tailor domain strategies effectively within the broader organisational framework. Their expertise in SAFe principles and leadership skills are central to nurturing a culture that is adaptable, innovative, and committed to delivering sustained value. The Domain Coachs primary responsibility lies in leading by influence rather than authority, playing a supportive role in the Domains agile journey.
Customer Value Optimisation: Articulate and continually refine the Domain's value proposition, tailoring lean-agile principles to maximize customer-focused outcomes and guide Domain strategy
Agile leadership and role modelling: Champion and lead the Domains ways of working, supporting agility, advocating for cultural shifts towards a more innovative and responsive mindset, and coaching the Domain Leadership Team on embracing and implementing an agile mindset through training and coaching, helping to guide the pathway to agile maturity. Brings in lean-agile standards and capabilities from their Chapter and the LACE. Helps to transform mindset, brings knowledge and support to teams and individuals
Governance Collaboration: Maintain a transparent and effective interface between the Domain and Rio Tinto's governance structures, negotiating any necessary adaptations to standard processes to better suit Domain objectives
Empowerment and Decision-Making: Instill a culture of distributed decision-making and empowerment, fostering collaborative cross-domain interactions and coordinating efforts to optimise the Domain's performance
Continuous Improvement and Facilitation: Drive ongoing improvements aligned with organisation principles, utilising feedback mechanisms for iterative enhancement and leading agile practices and events to facilitate team progress
Data-Driven Insights and Conflict Management: Leverage agile metrics for informed decision-making and problem-solving, assisting in conflict resolution to nurture a collaborative and progressive Domain environment
The Domain Coach is pivotal in promoting customer-focused value delivery and agile adoption within Rio Tinto, championing lean-agile principles, enhancing dialogue with governance, and uplifting ways of working in support of improved outcomes. This includes enabling the Domain Leadership Team through distributed decision-making, encouraging an agile mindset for innovation, and streamlining stakeholder communication to refine processes. They work with Product Line Owners and Release Train Engineers, using Agile metrics to guide decisions, mediate conflicts, and implement Lean Portfolio Management.

Expertise:
Applies agile principles and practices effectively within the Domain's context, enhancing strategic alignment and enabling a culture of fast feedback and continuous delivery
Strong facilitation skills; providing content-neutral guidance for individuals and groups leading to actionable solutions
Professional coaching, teaching and mentoring, building collaborative partnerships with a focus on self-directed learning and problem resolution
Leadership:
Navigates and aligns executive expectations with agile approaches, crucial for transforming traditional mindsets and driving business agility
Demonstrates experience in leading change, guiding the Domain through transitions with a focus on enhancing agile competencies across teams and stakeholders
Strategic:
Exhibits strong problem-solving capabilities, employing collaborative approaches to address challenges, which is key to maintaining progress and innovation in a dynamic environment
Interpersonal:
Possesses strong coaching skills to facilitate team growth, fostering self-organisation and improved performance which is essential for the sustainable success of ways of working
Maintains a commitment to continuous professional development and adapts to emerging agile practices, ensuring that the Domain remains at the forefront of industry advancements and best practices

Job Description:
At EY, youll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And were counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

People Consulting shapes and delivers the part of business strategy that depends on people. As a professional under this contract, you will have the opportunity to work with one of our largest clients to understand and address their challenges amidst an organization-wide learning transformation.

We believe that you should own and shape your career. But well provide the support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Your Key Responsibilities
Youll work with one of our largest clients to help them get the most out of their people. Youll use your knowledge and experience to help the client transforming its learning practices. With access to talented leaders, formal learning and a wide variety of practical experience, youll receive all the support you need to succeed.

Skills and attributes for success
Supporting client in their transformation journey with learning transformation efforts
Perform analyses of learning needs and redesign learning processes to ensure alignment with learning objectives and improve efficiency of resources used towards learning efforts
Improve the effectiveness of learning programs to more effectively achieve desired business outcomes.
To qualify for the role you must have
Bachelors in business, Commerce, Human Resources Management and/or other relevant disciplines
Certificates in ACTA/ACLP 1.0 or 2.0 is preferred
Prior experience in areas such as Learning business process redesign, learning science, curriculum design and learning analytics outcome would be an advantage.
At least 7 years of working experiences including 5 years in management consulting role
Proven ability to build valued relationships with stakeholders
Passion to create a positive learning culture, to coach and develop team members and clients
Good communications skills, especially fluent in written and spoken English.
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, youll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where youll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

Job Description:
The role is responsible for developing commercial strategies & securing long-term offtake agreements for RGEs renewable energy projects. This includes driving the marketing efforts, sourcing, and securing of PPA customers and managing relationships with potential energy buyers. The candidate will lead the negotiation, execution, and management of Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) and offtake contracts, ensuring the financial viability of projects through successful offtake agreements.

Key Responsibilities:
Commercial Strategy Development:
Develop and implement commercial strategies for securing long-term offtake agreements, ensuring projects profitability and financial sustainability.
Conduct market analysis to identify trends, potential buyers and pricing opportunities for renewable energy consumption.
Engage with stakeholders, including financiers, to align PPA structures with project financing needs.
Stakeholder & Client Management:
Build and maintain strong relationships with corporate buyers and power market related stakeholders.
Serve as the primary point of contact for PPA negotiations and management, ensuring open communication and collaboration with all parties.
Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and meetings to promote its PPA and offtake capabilities.
Marketing, Sourcing, and Securing PPA Customers:
Lead marketing efforts to promote RGE renewable energy projects and PPAs to potential corporate buyers such as international companies / MNCS with sustainability mandates & green electricity needs
Identify and source prospective PPA customers, building a robust pipeline of interested parties.
Develop customized proposals and marketing materials to attract and secure long-term PPA customers.
Drive business development efforts to expand the customer base and enhance the companys market presence in the renewable energy sector.
PPA Negotiation & Execution:
Lead the negotiation and execution of PPAs and other offtake agreements with corporate buyers & industry partners
Ensure agreement terms are commercially competitive and will optimize projects revenue potential
Collaborate with legal, financial, and technical teams to draft and review contracts, ensuring compliance with regulations and contractual obligations.
Risk Management & Compliance:
Identify and manage commercial risks associated with PPAs and offtake agreements, including market fluctuations, regulatory changes, and counterparty risks.
Ensure compliance with local and international energy market regulations and reporting requirements.
Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, or a related field. An MBA or equivalent advanced degree is preferred.
8 - 12 years of experience in PPA negotiation, energy offtake transactions, with a focus on renewable energy.
Expertise in commercial negotiations, contract structuring, stakeholder management, and marketing. Strong understanding of energy markets, regulatory environments, and renewable energy trends.
Excellent communications, negotiation and presentation skills.
Ability to manage complex contracts, work with cross-functional teams, and develop marketing strategies.
Strategic thinker with strong financial acumen and market insights

Job Description:
Job Description
Synthesize needs from Product, Engineering, and Marketing into comprehensive design deliverables, ensuring design is front-of-mind throughout the product development process
Work through design problems from beginning to end: translating qualitative or quantitative insights into ideas that form disruptive new products and features, then designing the workflows and detailed interactions to realize them
Support the product development process with wireframes, user flows, journey maps, high-fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and evaluative research
Partner with cross-functional peers within Product and Engineering in Asia and internationally to define initiatives and create thoughtful solutionsrepresenting design and being the voice for the user throughout the product lifecycle
Collaborate closely with UX Research, UX Writing, Brand, and Product leadership to shape the overall design vision of your area of ownership
Consistently elevate the quality of the design by soliciting feedback from peers and stakeholders through formal Design Reviews, presentations and by facilitating design thinking workshops
Job Requirements
At least 5 years of experience in Product Design, Interaction Design, UX Design, or related fields.
Strong communication skills with a proven ability to articulate ideas and advocate for design decisions.
Experience working with cross-functional teams, including Designers, Product Managers, Engineers, UX Writers, and Researchers.
A deep understanding of design-critical thinking and user-centered design methodologies, ensuring products offer intuitive and trustworthy experiences.
Results-oriented and adaptable to change.
A thorough understanding of experimentation and research techniques, capable of validating designs independently.
A good eye for design with a diverse portfolio of your design works throughout your career.
Min Bachelor's degree in Design, HCI, or equivalent practical experience
Experience designing for Fintech, Investment platforms, or Crypto products
Experience working with global teams across offices and timezones
A desire to mentor cross-functional peers and evangelize for great design
Interested applicants, please email your resume to Celine Tan Si Ling
